intro: Mesynium alatum, commonly known as the winged mesynium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its distinctive winged stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Mesynium alatum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
